conclusion: Analyze how shadows A, B, C, and D change when light source moves to front right, away from objects
Cylindrical object with white circular base casting shadow A
Small dark object casting shadow B
Cylindrical object's base casting shadow C
Paper airplane or folded triangular object casting shadow D
Light source is positioned to the left and behind objects
Shadows are cast forward and slightly to the right
All shadows will move to the back left when light moves to front right
Distance between objects and shadows will increase as light moves farther away
Shadows become less sharp/more diffuse when light source moves farther away
Shadows become more similar in size to the object when light source moves farther away
Shadows become more parallel (less divergent) when light source moves farther away
Shadow A will move to the back left, become smaller and less distorted, closer to actual shape
Shadow B will move to the back left, become more defined and less elongated, smaller
Shadow C will move to the back left, become more circular and less elliptical, more proportional
Shadow D will move to the back left, become smaller and more defined, match shape
Final answer: Shadows move back left, become smaller, less distorted, less sharp, distance increases
